author: sky.cactus
content: Sadly, you can't delete issues in GitHub, only close them.  Our repository has a bad spam problem (I think scammers trying to create a GitHub account that looks reputable at a glance), and I spend non zero amount of time dealing with it.  ðŸ˜– Best we can do I believe is just keep reporting them to GitHub (who does delete the accounts).

author: gcolvin
content: I suspect the best thing to do with Issues is ignore them if we can't turn them off.  They use up some numbers and server space regardless, so don't seem worth the effort of sorting through and closing.  Unfed trolls will go elsewhere, if we are lucky.

author: sky.cactus
content: The problem is that having your GitHub profile show you "contributed" to one or more Ethereum repositories is valuable when scamming users.  So the spammers will continue to bother us as long as people continue to fall for the "created an issue, must mean they are a developer in that repository" thing.
